lines.text: Spirit! They're gone! Spirit, they've vanished!

Merry Christmas. Out upon 'Merry Christmas!' If I could work my will, every fool who goes about with 'Merry Christmas' on his lips should be boiled with his own pudding and buried with a stake of holly through his heart! Bah! Humbug!
Hush my dear, tears cannot bring Tiny Tim back to us.

[singing]
Ringle, ringle, coins when they jingle, make such a lovely sound. Give them away and nobody can rob you.

[looks at a painting]
Imagine going out looking like this... lock me up for a loony they would.

[sees a horse from his window]
Hello! Hello there!
[horse neighs and rears in terror, then bolts]
Ah, the same to you! Oh, yes, indeed. A pleasant fellow.
